Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: களித்தறியேன் என்பது கைவிடுக நெஞ்சத்து ஒளித்ததூஉம் ஆங்கே மிகும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Let (the drunkard) give up saying 'I have never drunk'; (for) the moment (he drinks) he will simply betray his former attempt to conceal.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown trying to lie, saying 'I have never been drunk' ('களித்தறியேன் என்பது'). Their words are a fragile mask.
Layered_Composition.Midground: The moment they take a drink, the mask shatters. All the secrets and thoughts that were hidden deep inside their heart ('நெஞ்சத்து ஒளித்தது') are shown bursting out of them uncontrollably, like a flood of revealing images and symbols.
Layered_Composition.Background: The lie is instantly exposed by the reality of their intoxication. The act of drinking makes the very thing they tried to hide—their previous drunkenness—obvious to all.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: One should stop lying about being drunk, because the moment one drinks, all the secrets one has hidden in one's heart will come pouring out, revealing the lie.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The fragile mask of denial shattering is the key moment. The flood of hidden secrets bursting forth is the consequence of intoxication.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The lighting is normal, but explodes with chaotic color and light as the secrets burst forth.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A close-up on the person's face as the mask shatters and the secrets are revealed.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with complex particle effects for the flood of secrets.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: A sudden, chaotic burst of light.
